comment.author: 65906203@N00
comment._content: The SS Adriatic referred to was more likely the RMS Adriatic, a White Star Line ship that ran from Liverpool (and Southampton, for a time) in England to New York from 1907-1933. Also, in checking the ship's manifest on EllisIsland.org, it looks like Sherman misspelled his name. The manifest lists an inquiry being held for Thumbu Sanmy, age 17. He may have arrived with a relative, since the manifest also lists a Perumal Sanmy, age 18.

comment.author: 65906203@N00
comment._content: Aw shucks. Actually, my father's family came through Ellis Island around 1921, so I was already in love with their web site before I saw these photos. Being able to contribute information here is just the cherry on top. -- Seen on my Flickr home page. (?)

comment._content: thanks for digitising the rare photos!!!
